declarations.name: Interactive
declarations.default:
{
    render: (args) => html`
        <omni-check
            data-testid="test-check"
            label="${ifNotEmpty(args.label)}"
            .data="${args.data}"
            hint="${ifNotEmpty(args.hint)}"
            error="${ifNotEmpty(args.error)}"
            ?checked="${args.checked}"
            ?disabled="${args.disabled}"
            ?indeterminate="${args.indeterminate}">${
        args.indeterminate_icon ? html`${'\r\n'}${unsafeHTML(assignToSlot('indeterminate_icon', args.indeterminate_icon))}` : nothing
    }${args.check_icon ? html`${'\r\n'}${unsafeHTML(assignToSlot('check_icon', args.check_icon))}` : nothing}${
        args.check_icon || args.indeterminate_icon ? '\r\n' : nothing
    }${unsafeHTML(args['[Default Slot]'])}</omni-check>
    `,
    frameworkSources: [
        {
            framework: 'Vue',
            load: (args) =>
                getSourceFromLit(Interactive!.render!(args), undefined, (s) =>
                    s
                        .replace(' disabled', ' :disabled="true"')
                        .replace(' indeterminate', ' :indeterminate="true"')
                        .replace(' checked', ' :checked="true"')
                )
        }
    ],
    name: 'Interactive',
    args: {
        label: '',
        data: {},
        hint: '',
        error: '',
        checked: false,
        disabled: false,
        indeterminate: false,
        check_icon: '',
        indeterminate_icon: '',
        '[Default Slot]': undefined
    }
}

declarations.name: Custom_Check_Icon
declarations.default:
{
    render: (args: Args) => html`
    <omni-check data-testid="test-check" label="${args.label}" ?checked="${args.checked}"> ${unsafeHTML(args.check_icon)} </omni-check>
  `,
    frameworkSources: [
        {
            framework: 'React',
            load: (args) => `import { OmniCheck } from "@capitec/omni-components-react/check";

const App = () => <OmniCheck${args.label ? ` label='${args.label}'` : ''}${args.checked ? ` checked` : ''}>
                    <svg slot="check_icon" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 442.79 410.38" version="1.0" width="100%" height="100%">
                        <path style={{stroke: '#000', strokeWidth: '19.892', fill: 'lightgreen'}}
                            d="m-1747.2-549.3 287.72 333.9c146.6-298.83 326.06-573.74 614.52-834.75-215.89 121.82-453.86 353.14-657.14 639.38l-245.1-138.53z"
                            transform="translate(843.77 509.04) scale(.48018)" />
                    </svg>
                </OmniCheck>;`
        },
        {
            framework: 'Vue',
            load: (args) =>
                getSourceFromLit(Custom_Check_Icon!.render!(args), undefined, (s) =>
                    s
                        .replace(' disabled', ' :disabled="true"')
                        .replace(' indeterminate', ' :indeterminate="true"')
                        .replace(' checked', ' :checked="true"')
                )
        }
    ],
    description: 'Set html content to render when the component is in a checked state.',
    args: {
        label: 'Custom Check Icon',
        checked: true,
        check_icon: raw`
            <svg slot="check_icon" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 442.79 410.38" version="1.0" width="100%"
                height="100%">
                <path style="stroke:#000;stroke-width:19.892;fill:lightgreen"
                d="m-1747.2-549.3 287.72 333.9c146.6-298.83 326.06-573.74 614.52-834.75-215.89 121.82-453.86 353.14-657.14 639.38l-245.1-138.53z"
                transform="translate(843.77 509.04) scale(.48018)" />
            </svg>
        `
    }
}
declarations.description: Set html content to render when the component is in a checked state.

    render: (args: Args) => html`

      ${unsafeHTML(args.indeterminate_icon)}
    </omni-check>
  `,
    frameworkSources: [
        {
            framework: 'React',
            load: (args) => `import { OmniCheck } from "@capitec/omni-components-react/check";

const App = () => <OmniCheck${args.label ? ` label='${args.label}'` : ''}${args.indeterminate ? ` indeterminate` : ''}>
                    <svg slot="indeterminate_icon" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 32 32" width="100%" height="100%">
                        <defs>
                        <linearGradient id="b" y2="28.275" gradientUnits="userSpaceOnUse" x2="20.07" y1="3.976" x1="12.113">
                            <stop style={{stopColor: '#ffffff'}} offset="0" />

                        </linearGradient>
                        <linearGradient id="a" y2="30" gradientUnits="userSpaceOnUse" x2="20.214" y1="2" x1="12.031">
                            <stop style={{stopColor: '#ffffff'}} offset="0" />
                            <stop style={{stopColor: '#ffffff'}} offset="1" />
                        </linearGradient>
                        </defs>
                        <path d="M2.875 13C1.281 13 0 14.338 0 16s1.28 3 2.875 3h26.25C30.719 19 32 17.662 32 16s-1.281-3-2.875-3H2.875z" />
                        <path style={{fill:'url(#b)'}} transform="translate(-.063 .063)"
                        d="M2.875 13.938c-1.067 0-1.938.884-1.938 2.062s.87 2.062 1.938 2.062h26.25c1.067 0 1.937-.884 1.937-2.062s-.87-2.062-1.937-2.062H2.875z" />
                    </svg>
                </OmniCheck>;`
        },
        {
            framework: 'Vue',
            load: (args) =>
                getSourceFromLit(Custom_Indeterminate_Icon!.render!(args), undefined, (s) =>
                    s
                        .replace(' disabled', ' :disabled="true"')
                        .replace(' indeterminate', ' :indeterminate="true"')
                        .replace(' checked', ' :checked="true"')
                )
        }
    ],
    description: 'Set html content to render when the component is in an indeterminate state.',
    args: {
        label: 'Custom Indeterminate Icon',
        indeterminate: true,
        indeterminate_icon: raw`
			<svg slot="indeterminate_icon" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 32 32" width="100%" height="100%">
				<defs>
				<linearGradient id="b" y2="28.275" gradientUnits="userSpaceOnUse" x2="20.07" y1="3.976" x1="12.113">
					<stop style="stop-color:#ffffff" offset="0" />
					<stop style="stop-color:#ffffff" offset="1" />
				</linearGradient>
				<linearGradient id="a" y2="30" gradientUnits="userSpaceOnUse" x2="20.214" y1="2" x1="12.031">
					<stop style="stop-color:#ffffff" offset="0" />
					<stop style="stop-color:#ffffff" offset="1" />
				</linearGradient>
				</defs>
				<path d="M2.875 13C1.281 13 0 14.338 0 16s1.28 3 2.875 3h26.25C30.719 19 32 17.662 32 16s-1.281-3-2.875-3H2.875z" />
				<path style="fill:url(#b)" transform="translate(-.063 .063)"
				d="M2.875 13.938c-1.067 0-1.938.884-1.938 2.062s.87 2.062 1.938 2.062h26.25c1.067 0 1.937-.884 1.937-2.062s-.87-2.062-1.937-2.062H2.875z" />
			</svg>

members.name: attachMode
members.description:
The rule for the Keyboard to attach to inputs for showing on component focus.
* `all` - The Keyboard will show on focus for all input related components unless opted out with `data-omni-keyboard-hidden` on the component.
* `attribute` - The Keyboard will only show on focus for input related components with the `data-omni-keyboard-attach` attribute
* `id` - The Keyboard will only show on focus for input related components with the `data-omni-keyboard-attach` attribute set equal to the Keyboard's id

members.name: closeLabel
members.description: The text label to display by the close button.

members.name: spaceLabel
members.description: The text label to display on the spacebar button.

members.name: clearLabel
members.description: The text label to display on the clear button. The `clear` slot takes precedence over this label.

members.name: actionLabel
members.description: The text label to display on the call to action button when `enterkeyhint` is not defined or `enterkeyhint="enter"`. The `action-enter` slot takes precedence over this label.

attributes.description:
The rule for the Keyboard to attach to inputs for showing on component focus.
* `all` - The Keyboard will show on focus for all input related components unless opted out with `data-omni-keyboard-hidden` on the component.
* `attribute` - The Keyboard will only show on focus for input related components with the `data-omni-keyboard-attach` attribute
* `id` - The Keyboard will only show on focus for input related components with the `data-omni-keyboard-attach` attribute set equal to the Keyboard's id

Disables the Keyboard for that component.
Indicates that the Keyboard is to render in specified type of inputmode. Takes precedence over `inputmode` attribute.
Indicates that the Keyboard's call to action button must render (and in some cases behave) accordingly.
Indicates that the call to action button inserts a new line instead of default behaviour.
Indicates that the Keyboard display value must be masked.
Disables the Keyboard display value. Takes precedence over `data-omni-keyboard-mask`.

declarations.name: maskAttribute
declarations.default: 'data-omni-keyboard-mask'
declarations.description: Indicates that the Keyboard display value must be masked.

declarations.name: multiLineAttribute
declarations.default: 'data-omni-keyboard-multi-line'
declarations.description: Indicates that the call to action button inserts a new line instead of default behaviour.

declarations.name: hiddenAttribute
declarations.default: 'data-omni-keyboard-hidden'
declarations.description: Disables the Keyboard for that component.

declarations.name: noDisplayValueAttribute
declarations.default: 'data-omni-keyboard-no-display'
declarations.description: Disables the Keyboard display value. Takes precedence over `data-omni-keyboard-mask`.

declarations.name: attachAttribute
declarations.default: 'data-omni-keyboard-attach'
declarations.description: Indicates that the Keyboard is enabled for that component when the Keyboard has `attach-mode="attribute"` or when the value is equal to the Keyboard's id and `attach-mode="id"`.

declarations.name: explicitKeyboardMode
declarations.default: 'data-omni-keyboard-mode'
declarations.description: Indicates that the Keyboard is to render in specified type of inputmode. Takes precedence over `inputmode` attribute.

declarations.name: Interactive
declarations.default:
{
    render: (args) => html`
        <omni-currency-field
            data-testId="test-currency-field"
            label="${ifNotEmpty(args.label)}"
            value="${ifNotEmpty(args.value)}"
            hint="${ifNotEmpty(args.hint)}"
            error="${ifNotEmpty(args.error)}"
            ?disabled="${args.disabled}"
            ?clearable="${args.clearable}"
            fractional-precision="${args.fractionalPrecision}"
            fractional-separator="${ifNotEmpty(args.fractionalSeparator)}"
            thousands-separator="${ifNotEmpty(args.thousandsSeparator)}"
            currency-symbol="${ifNotEmpty(args.currencySymbol)}"
            formatter="${ifNotEmpty(args.formatter)}"           
            >${args.prefix ? html`${'\r\n'}${unsafeHTML(assignToSlot('prefix', args.prefix))}` : nothing}
            ${args.clear ? html`${'\r\n'}${unsafeHTML(assignToSlot('clear', args.clear))}` : nothing}${
        args.suffix ? html`${'\r\n'}${unsafeHTML(assignToSlot('suffix', args.suffix))}` : nothing
    }${args.prefix || args.suffix || args.clear ? '\r\n' : nothing}</omni-currency-field>
    `,
    frameworkSources: [
        {
            framework: 'Lit',
            sourceParts: {
                htmlFragment: (args) => getSourceFromLit(Interactive!.render!(args), undefined, (s) => s.replace('formatter', '.formatter'))
            }
        },
        {
            framework: 'Vue',
            load: (args) =>
                getSourceFromLit(Interactive!.render!(args), undefined, (s) =>
                    s.replace(' disabled', ' :disabled="true"').replace(' clearable', ' :clearable="true"')
                )
        }
    ],
    name: 'Interactive',
    args: {
        label: 'Label',
        value: '123456789',
        hint: '',
        error: '',
        disabled: false,
        clearable: false,
        prefix: '',
        suffix: '',
        clear: '',
        fractionalPrecision: 2,
        fractionalSeparator: '.',
        thousandsSeparator: ',',
        currencySymbol: '$',
        formatter: '\\B(?=(\\d{3})+(?!\\d))'
    }
}

declarations.name: Interactive
declarations.description:
The Keyboard supports <input> and <textarea> elements as well as custom web components that internally utilise <input> or <textarea> elements.

All Omni Components input fields are fully supported.

declarations.name: Attach_By_Attribute
declarations.description: When the attach-mode attribute is set to 'attribute' on the Keyboard, then the Keyboard will only react to supported inputs with the data-omni-keyboard-attach attribute without a value.

declarations.name: Attach_By_Id
declarations.description: When the attach-mode attribute is set to 'id' on the Keyboard, then it will only react to supported inputs with the data-omni-keyboard-attach attribute set equal to the Keyboard's id.

declarations.name: Enter_Key_Hint_Variations
declarations.default:
{ ...Interactive, description: () => html` When the enterkeyhint attribute is set on a supported input, the Keyboard's call to action button will react to it accordingly. It is supported as follows:
  • 'enter' (Default) - The action-enter slot will apply to the call to action button. If not provided, the value defined with the action-label attribute on the keyboard will be displayed on the call to action button.
  • 'go' - The action-go slot will apply to the call to action button. If not provided, a right arrow icon will be displayed by default.
  • 'done' - The action-done slot will apply to the call to action button. If not provided, a checkmark icon will be displayed by default.
  • 'next' - The action-next slot will apply to the call to action button. If not provided, an icon of a right arrow within a circle will be displayed by default.
  • 'previous' - The action-previous slot will apply to the call to action button. If not provided, an icon of a left arrow within a circle will be displayed by default. The Keyboard's default behaviour of focusing the next tabIndex will also reverse to focus the previous instead.
  • 'search' - The action-search slot will apply to the call to action button. If not provided, a magnifying glass icon will be displayed by default.
  • 'send' - The action-send slot will apply to the call to action button. If not provided, a paper plane icon will be displayed by default.
 `, frameworkSources: [{ framework: 'HTML', load: () => getSourceFromLit(attachByAttribute), disableCodePen: true }], render: (args: Args) => Interactive.args!.attachMode === 'all' ? html`
Text input with enterkeyhint="enter" Number input with enterkeyhint="enter" Text input with enterkeyhint="go" Number input with enterkeyhint="go" Text input with enterkeyhint="done" Number input with enterkeyhint="done" Text input with enterkeyhint="next" Number input with enterkeyhint="next" Text input with enterkeyhint="previous" Number input with enterkeyhint="previous" Text input with enterkeyhint="search" Number input with enterkeyhint="search" Text input with enterkeyhint="send" Number input with enterkeyhint="send"
` : html`
To illustrate this, update the Interactive Keyboard properties to have attach-mode attribute set to 'attach-mode'. Update attach-mode to 'all'
`, name: 'Enter Key Hint Variations' }
declarations.description:

  • 'enter' (Default) - The action-enter slot will apply to the call to action button. If not provided, the value defined with the action-label attribute on the keyboard will be displayed on the call to action button.
  • 'go' - The action-go slot will apply to the call to action button. If not provided, a right arrow icon will be displayed by default.
  • 'done' - The action-done slot will apply to the call to action button. If not provided, a checkmark icon will be displayed by default.
  • 'next' - The action-next slot will apply to the call to action button. If not provided, an icon of a right arrow within a circle will be displayed by default.
  • 'previous' - The action-previous slot will apply to the call to action button. If not provided, an icon of a left arrow within a circle will be displayed by default. The Keyboard's default behaviour of focusing the next tabIndex will also reverse to focus the previous instead.
  • 'search' - The action-search slot will apply to the call to action button. If not provided, a magnifying glass icon will be displayed by default.
  • 'send' - The action-send slot will apply to the call to action button. If not provided, a paper plane icon will be displayed by default.

  • Any supported web component utilising data-omni-keyboard-mask on their internal <input> elements.

` : html`

declarations.name: Interactive
Showing_Toasts
declarations.description: Toasts can be shown programmatically using the static Toast.show() function.

declarations.name: Configure_Toast
declarations.description: Programmatically shown Toasts can be configured using the static Toast.configure() function.

declarations.name: Replacing_Toasts
declarations.description: Toasts can be replaced instead of stacked when shown programmatically via the static Toast.show() function by using the static Toast.configure() function to set stack to false.

declarations.name: Custom_Slotted_Content
declarations.description: Custom rich html can be slotted to fully customize the contents displayed within the <omni-toast>. This can be used to apply extra styling and functionality.

declarations.name: Type
declarations.default:
{ description: () => html`

Set the display type of the <omni-toast>.


The 'type' attribute supports the following options:

  • 'success' - Green themed toast with a checkmark icon to indicate success.
  • 'warning' - Orange themed toast with a yield icon to indicate warning.
  • 'error' - Red themed toast with an exclamation icon to indicate error.
  • 'info' - Blue themed toast with an information icon to indicate info.
  • 'none' - Default themed toast with no icon. (Default)
`, render: (args: Args) => html` ${args.prefix ? html`${unsafeHTML(assignToSlot('prefix', args.prefix))}` : nothing} ${unsafeHTML(args['[Default Slot]'])} ${args.close ? html`${unsafeHTML(assignToSlot('close', args.close))}` : nothing} `, frameworkSources: [ { framework: 'React', load: (args) => `import { OmniToast } from "@capitec/omni-components-react/toast"; const App = () => ;` } ], name: 'Type', args: { closeable: false, detail: 'The toast description', header: 'The toast header', type: 'warning', prefix: undefined, '[Default Slot]': undefined, close: undefined } }

declarations.name: Interactive
declarations.description:
The <omni-toast-stack> component can be authored as an element or created via script.

This example illustrates the component authored as an element. An important consideration to keep in mind when using this approach is that in order for the element to properly overlay all other content, it needs to be a root level element to avoid z-index related issues.

Creating the <omni-toast-stack> via script can help avoid this issue as it by default parents the newly created instance to the document body. The parent can still be specified to be a different element, however the same considerations will then apply.

declarations.name: Slotted_Toasts
declarations.default:
{ description: () => html`

Display slotted <omni-toast> elements in order.

Slotted toasts can be configured to auto-close after specified milliseconds with the data-toast-duration attribute, after which they will be removed from the parent element.

Slotted toasts with the closeable attribute will be removed from the parent element when their close-click event gets fired (usually via click of the close button).

`, render: (args: Args) => { return html`Show Toasts`; }, frameworkSources: [ { framework: 'HTML', load: (args) => getSourceFromLit(renderStack(args)) }, { framework: 'Vue', load: (args) => getSourceFromLit(renderStack(args)).replaceAll(' closeable', ' :closeable="true"').replaceAll(' reverse', ' :reverse="true"') }, { framework: 'React', load: (args) => `import { OmniToast, OmniToastStack } from "@capitec/omni-components-react/toast"; const App = () => ;` } ], name: 'Slotted Toasts', args: { reverse: false, position: 'bottom', '[Default Slot]': raw` ` } }
declarations.description:
Display slotted <omni-toast> elements in order.

Slotted toasts can be configured to auto-close after specified milliseconds with the data-toast-duration attribute, after which they will be removed from the parent element.

Slotted toasts with the closeable attribute will be removed from the parent element when their close-click event gets fired (usually via click of the close button).

declarations.name: Show_From_Script
declarations.description:
Create new <omni-toast> elements from script.

Toasts can be configured to auto-close after specified milliseconds with the duration property, after which they will be removed from the parent element.

Toasts with the closeable property will be removed from the parent element when their close-click event gets fired (usually via click of the close button).

All <omni-toast> attributes can be configured as well as additional render functions that can bed provided for slotted content on the toasts.

declarations.name: Create_From_Script
declarations.description:
Create an <omni-toast-stack> instance from script.

An important consideration to keep in mind when using authoring the element via html is that in order for the element to properly overlay all other content, it needs to be a root level element to avoid z-index related issues.

Creating the <omni-toast-stack> via script as in this example can help avoid this issue as it by default parents the newly created instance to the document body. The parent can still be specified to be a different element, however the same considerations will then apply.

declarations.name: Position
declarations.description:
Position <omni-toast> elements in the stack.


The 'position' attribute supports the following options:

  • 'top'
  • 'bottom' (Default)
  • 'left'
  • 'right'
  • 'top-left'
  • 'top-right'
  • 'bottom-left'
  • 'bottom-right'

declarations.name: Reverse
declarations.description:
Reverse <omni-toast> elements in the stack.

By default newest toasts are showed at the bottom of the stack. When reversed, newest toasts are showed on top of the stack.
